item.title: Week 5
item.description:
📅 Week 5 (June 17–22): final steps

The last week before the official end of the semester — grades were finalized, and we completed reflections for the courses.
I worked on the final report for mathematical logic, reviewed the lectures, and revisited the proofs that had caused difficulties earlier.

🏁 Summary:

  • All exams completed: programming, math analysis, logic — ✅
  • Enrolled in a summer school on applied analytics
  • Wrote a post with recommendations and materials for first-year students — happy to share my experience

item.title: Week 4
item.description:
📅 Week 4 (June 10–16): the second exam

The mathematical analysis exam took place on Tuesday. It included 4 theoretical questions and 3 problems — covering derivatives, extreme points, and definite integrals.
The problems were challenging, but I managed to recall all the required steps. Final result: 82 points.

📊 Academic highlights:

  • Learned integration techniques: by parts and substitution.
  • Reviewed convergence criteria for numerical series.
  • Started wrapping up the semester — took notes on what to focus on during summer.

item.title: Week 3
item.description:
📅 Week 3 (June 3–9): first exam week

The programming exam took place this week. It included both a written and a practical section. In the practical part, we wrote Python functions and debugged code.
I scored 90 points — happy that all the preparation paid off. My debugging and testing practice really helped!

📌 Focus of the week:

  • Rewrote older assignments to get a deeper grasp of algorithms.
  • Started revising theorems and techniques for analysis — the second exam is coming soon.
  • Joined a group session to review math analysis problems — turned out to be very productive!

item.title: Week 2
item.description:
📅 Week 2 (May 27 – June 2): peak of preparation

This week was all about mathematical analysis. In lectures, we covered limits, derivatives, and important theorems — Bolzano-Cauchy, Lagrange, and Rolle.
During practice sessions, we worked on proving convergence and analyzing functions. Challenging, but very engaging!

📘 Achievements:

  • Completed all programming lab assignments — wrote parsers and basic sorting algorithms.
  • Passed the logic credit test successfully.
  • Made condensed notes for the math analysis exam — super handy for revision!

item.title: Week 1
item.description:
📅 Week 1 (May 20–26): the start of exam season

This week we completed the final module in mathematical logic. There was a fascinating lecture on propositional calculus and the concept of deductive systems.
In the seminar, we practiced problems on proving the derivability of formulas — not everything worked on the first try, but it became clear how important it is to structure logical reasoning clearly.

🔍 Highlights of the week:

  • Final logic test — scored 85 points!
  • Read a chapter on normal forms and reviewed CNF and DNF.
  • Started preparing for the programming exam: revised Python topics — lists, dictionaries, and functions.
